alert.note: Alert for Greensville; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 12:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GREENSVILLE... SOUTHWESTERN SOUTHAMPTON AND SOUTH CENTRAL SUSSEX COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF EMPORIA THROUGH 1245 PM EDT... At 1210 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Claresville, or 8 miles southeast of Emporia, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Green Plain around 1215 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Adams Grove, Gray, Grizzard, Mason, Drewryville, Bryants Corner, Slagles Lake, Little Texas, and Emporia Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
